content:
• Friday, October 28, 2011
  • CP

    Canadian Pacific Railways (NYSE:CP) shares +8.4% AH after an SEC filing reveals Bill Ackman's...

    Canadian Pacific Railways (NYSE:CP) shares +8.4% AH after an SEC filing reveals Bill Ackman's Pershing Square hedge fund took a 12.2% stake. The filing says Pershing believes CP shares are “undervalued and are an attractive investment," but does not indicate any takeover interest.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:03 PM
  • EJ

    Chinese real estate servicer E-House (EJ +11.8%) jumped today after making a bid for the...

    Chinese real estate servicer E-House (EJ +11.8%) jumped today after making a bid for the remaining shares of China Real Estate Information (CRIC +17.2%) in a deal valued at about $960M. The company is already the majority shareholder, owning 54.1% of the total outstanding shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:39 PM
  • BKS

    Barnes & Noble (BKS +5.8%) rose today after The Digital Reader's sources confirmed the...

    Barnes & Noble (BKS +5.8%) rose today after The Digital Reader's sources confirmed the company will ship the next-gen version of its Nook Color on Nov. 7, a week before Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN) begins shipping the Kindle Fire. B&N shares have strongly underperformed the S&P since Amazon's September Kindle announcements.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:29 PM | 1 Comment
  • CBRE

    CB Richard Ellis Group (CBG) jumped +14.5% today after reporting its Q3 Y/Y profit jumped 12% on...

    CB Richard Ellis Group (CBG) jumped +14.5% today after reporting its Q3 Y/Y profit jumped 12% on higher property and leasing revenue. Global profit rose significantly in nearly all major service lines and geographies, reflecting a potential commercial real estate market recovery.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:08 PM
  • OMCL

    Omnicell (NASDAQ:OMCL), a provider of medication-dispensing systems, fell 9.9% after posting Q3...

    Omnicell (NASDAQ:OMCL), a provider of medication-dispensing systems, fell 9.9% after posting Q3 results. While revenue of $64.4M (+5.6% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.16 beat consensus by $1.9M and $0.01, and full-year EPS guidance is solid, the company mentioned on its call that meeting its 2011 backlog guidance will depend on the timing of some major deals.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:01 PM
  • TMUS

    MetroPCS (PCS -9.2%) took a hard hit today after BofA Merrill Lynch downgraded the stock to...

    MetroPCS (PCS -9.2%) took a hard hit today after BofA Merrill Lynch downgraded the stock to Underperform, citing increased competition and network capex and challenges.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:48 PM
  • TSLA

    Tesla Motors (TSLA +3.9%) rose today after CEO Elon Musk told Bloomberg TV his company has sold...

    Tesla Motors (TSLA +3.9%) rose today after CEO Elon Musk told Bloomberg TV his company has sold out next year's 6,500-unit production run for its Model S sedan, and that Tesla, which has posted losses ever since it went public, should turn a profit in 2013.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:44 PM | 11 Comments
  • ORI

    Old Republic International (ORI -9.3%) dips after Raymond James downgraded the stock earlier...

    Old Republic International (ORI -9.3%) dips after Raymond James downgraded the stock earlier today to Underperform on the back of its disappointing Q3 earnings report yesterday and an uncertain outlook.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:28 PM
  • AMD

    Although Advanced Micro Devices (AMD +8%) enjoys a big boost after a better-than-expected Q3 and...

    Although Advanced Micro Devices (AMD +8%) enjoys a big boost after a better-than-expected Q3 and higher guidance, analysts are only lukewarm. JPMorgan says AMD may be losing market share to Intel (NASDAQ:INTC) because of lingering supply shortages; Credit Suisse calls it "a tradeable stock, still not an investible company." Wells Fargo offers the most upbeat view.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:53 PM | 3 Comments
  • ESL

    Esterline Technologies (ESL -4.7%) trades down after Credit Suisse cut the shares to Neutral....

    Esterline Technologies (ESL -4.7%) trades down after Credit Suisse cut the shares to Neutral. The firm cites a lack of catalysts over the near term, and a decline in C-130 retrofits.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:52 PM
  • CMPR

    VistaPrint (VPRT +11.7%) pops after reporting FQ1 revenue of $212.4M (+25% Y/Y) and EPS of...

    VistaPrint (VPRT +11.7%) pops after reporting FQ1 revenue of $212.4M (+25% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.31, beating consensus by $2.4M and $0.07. The company, an online provider of business cards and other marketing products, expects FQ2 revenue of $270M-$290M and EPS of $0.68-$0.78, compared with a consensus of $284.4M and $0.65. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:44 PM
  • TDY

    Teledyne Technologies (TDY -6.5%) is trading lower after its Q3 beats Street estimates, but...

    Teledyne Technologies (TDY -6.5%) is trading lower after its Q3 beats Street estimates, but warns that its Q4 is likely to miss due to a slowdown in federal spending. Net sales increased 21% Y/Y, and gross margin increased sequentially as well, but was partially offset by greater internal R&D expenses.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:39 PM
  • BIDU

    One might expect Baidu (BIDU +4.3%) to be the top-performing Chinese Internet stock today...

    One might expect Baidu (BIDU +4.3%) to be the top-performing Chinese Internet stock today following its Q3 report (I, II), but Renren (RENN +14.8%), Youku (YOKU +12.3%), and DangDang (DANG +17.5%) are posting much bigger gains. The reason? It could have something to do with these firms possessing short ratios 3-9x as large as Baidu's.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:27 PM | 1 Comment
  • VMED

    Morgan Stanley piles on to Virgin Media (VMED -5.5%), cutting it to Equalweight" from Overweight...

    Morgan Stanley piles on to Virgin Media (VMED -5.5%), cutting it to Equalweight" from Overweight in the wake of its Q3 report yesterday.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:24 PM
  • DRC

    Dresser-Rand Group (DRC -5%) takes a hit after Morgan Stanley cuts the shares from Overweight to...

    Dresser-Rand Group (DRC -5%) takes a hit after Morgan Stanley cuts the shares from Overweight to Equalweight on valuation. The stock has been on a tear over the past year, netting an impressive +38% return since early August.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:20 PM
  • OUTR

    Coinstar (CSTR -7.6%) remains down sharply, as concerns about its price hike outweigh the...

    Coinstar (CSTR -7.6%) remains down sharply, as concerns about its price hike outweigh the company's Q3 beat and healthy Q4 guidance. But Netflix (NFLX +3.2%) is getting a much-needed boost from Coinstar's move, as well as from a bullish note by Oppenheimer.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:06 PM | 2 Comments
  • CPN

    Calpine (CPN +3.5%) trades higher after it misses on its Q3 EPS target, but beats on revenues....

    Calpine (CPN +3.5%) trades higher after it misses on its Q3 EPS target, but beats on revenues. Y/Y earnings declined slightly, mostly due to the sale of certain assets. The company reaffirms the high-end targets of its FY11 guidance, but also warns of increasing competitive pressures.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:02 PM | 1 Comment
  • VC

    Visteon (VC +9.6%) spikes in afternoon trading after five sources tell Bloomberg the automotive...

    Visteon (VC +9.6%) spikes in afternoon trading after five sources tell Bloomberg the automotive systems maker is looking to sell its Lighting and Interiors divisions. The divisions produced $2.7B in revenue last year, and it's speculated they could fetch up to $450M in a sale.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:51 PM
  • EA

    Electronic Arts (ERTS -2.7%) remains lower after its FQ2 beat and guidance hike, as investors...

    Electronic Arts (ERTS -2.7%) remains lower after its FQ2 beat and guidance hike, as investors take profits on shares that were up over 50% YTD. Concerns persist about EA's ability to adjust to its customers' growing preference for social and mobile games; EA's smartphone game sales rose 87%, but still only accounted for 8% of its revenue. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:43 PM
  • RBBN

    Sonus Networks (SONS +15%) pops after Miller Tabak upgrades the shares to Buy on valuation,...

    Sonus Networks (SONS +15%) pops after Miller Tabak upgrades the shares to Buy on valuation, despite despite the company's mediocre Q3 report and lowered guidance yesterday. The broker says the company's fundamentals are improving and it's growing its customer base.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:30 PM
  • MFGLQ

    Speculation swirls around who ultimately will pick up the pieces of MF Global (MF -2.8%)....

    Speculation swirls around who ultimately will pick up the pieces of MF Global (MF -2.8%). WSJ lists Goldman Sachs (NYSE:GS), State Street (NYSE:STT) and Macquarie as potential bidders for all or parts. NY Post says CEO Jon Corzine asked Barclays (NYSE:BCS) about a deal, but that it is unlikely to come through. Any move could happen fast, given MF's loss of some customer assets and declining stock price.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM | 1 Comment
  • ELX

    Emulex (ELX +13.1%) surges after reporting FQ1 revenue of $118.4M (+15% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.13,...

    Emulex (ELX +13.1%) surges after reporting FQ1 revenue of $118.4M (+15% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.13, beating consensus by $2.8M and $0.02. The storage adapter card vendor expects FQ2 revenue of $121M-$127M and EPS of $0.17-$0.20, largely above a consensus of $122.2M and $0.16. Archrival QLogic (QLGC +2.4%) is up more modestly after delivering in-line results.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:21 PM
  • EXPE

    Down only slightly AH yesterday, Expedia (EXPE -7.4%) is falling hard today, as investors show...

    Down only slightly AH yesterday, Expedia (EXPE -7.4%) is falling hard today, as investors show disappointment with its top-line miss and weak plane ticket revenue. Wedbush is maintaining an Outperform, but has concerns about the company's U.S. sales and Expedia.com growth. Rival Priceline (PCLN +0.1%) is unaffected. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:09 PM
  • BBBY

    Bed Bath & Beyond (BBBY ) -3.3% grabs an Outperform rating from Williams Capital with a...

    Bed Bath & Beyond (BBBY ) -3.3% grabs an Outperform rating from Williams Capital with a price objective of $77. The initiation stands in contrast to Morgan Stanley's take on BBBY, as analysts with the firm start coverage with a docile-sounding Underweight rating.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:03 PM
  • VMED

    Virgin Media (NASDAQ:VMED), which fell yesterday following Q3 results, drops 5.1% today after...

    Virgin Media (NASDAQ:VMED), which fell yesterday following Q3 results, drops 5.1% today after Goldman removes the telco from its Conviction Buy list, arguing its capex increases will limit 2012 free cash flow. However, Nomura is coming to the company's defense, claiming its valuation is low, and a massive stock buyback program will help support shares. (Q3 transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM
  • LYB

    LyondellBasell Industries (LYB +1.3%) trades up after its Q3 beats estimates earlier today....

    LyondellBasell Industries (LYB +1.3%) trades up after its Q3 beats estimates earlier today. Profit soared 92% Y/Y on strong sales volume, most notably in its domestic refining and oxyfuels segments.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:58 PM
  • ARCH

    Coal miners continue to rebound as investors see bullish signs between the lines of a mixed...

    Coal miners continue to rebound as investors see bullish signs between the lines of a mixed earnings season for the sector. Arch Coal (ACI +7.6%) jumps despite plunging Q3 results after announcing 2012 sales that have been booked at high prices. Cloud Peak Energy (CLD +2.9%) and Cliffs Natural Resources (CLF +3.9%) rise after upbeat guidance (I, II).

     
     
     
     
    | 1:57 PM
  • DWDP

    Dupont (DD +2.2%) is considering selling its auto-paint unit. The sale could potentially bring...

    Dupont (DD +2.2%) is considering selling its auto-paint unit. The sale could potentially bring as much as $3B - $4B.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:45 PM
  • OLN

    Shares of Olin (NYSE:OLN) fall 7.5% after Wells Fargo downgrades to Market Perform on a...

    Shares of Olin (NYSE:OLN) fall 7.5% after Wells Fargo downgrades to Market Perform on a valuation call. Analysts with the firm cut EPS estimates for FY11 and FY12 to $1.65 and $2.00, respectively, on lower demand for chlorine .
     
     
     
     
    | 1:32 PM
  • UHS

    Universal Health Services (UHS +6.4%) gains after it Q3 beat EPS estimates on a boost to its...

    Universal Health Services (UHS +6.4%) gains after it Q3 beat EPS estimates on a boost to its bottom line operating margins. Profit jumped 53% Y/Y on higher same-facility revenue in both acute-care and behavioral health facilities.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:27 PM
  • STMP

    Stamps.com (STMP +22.4%) skyrockets after reporting Q3 revenue of $25.9M (+20% Y/Y) and EPS of...

    Stamps.com (STMP +22.4%) skyrockets after reporting Q3 revenue of $25.9M (+20% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.37, beating consensus by $1.4M and $0.08. The company is lifting its 2011 revenue guidance range by $2.5M, to $92.5M-$102.5M, and its EPS range by $0.10, to $1.20-$1.40. Stamps.com is up 139% YTD, partly thanks to the USPS' rate hikes and cost cuts. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:18 PM
  • SPPI

    Spectrum Pharmaceuticals (SPPI +5.5%) trades up after its Q3 easily tops estimates. The company...

    Spectrum Pharmaceuticals (SPPI +5.5%) trades up after its Q3 easily tops estimates. The company reported EPS of $0.34 on revenue of $51M. Analysts expectations were for an EPS of $0.10 on revenue of $40M. The company also says it is currently on track to file two New Drug Applications in 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:11 PM
  • TEN

    Tenneco (TEN -9.4%) takes a hit after its Q3 revenue misses estimates, masking what appears on...

    Tenneco (TEN -9.4%) takes a hit after its Q3 revenue misses estimates, masking what appears on the surface to be a solid quarter. Earnings tripled as the auto-parts supplier continued to see strong demand worldwide. Revenue increased 10% in North America, 25% in Asia, and 19% in Europe, South America and India.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:51 PM
  • SBGL

    Stillwater Mining (SWC +22.9%) soars after its Q3 blows away estimates. Earnings leapt on...

    Stillwater Mining (SWC +22.9%) soars after its Q3 blows away estimates. Earnings leapt on double-digit revenue growth stemming from an increase in production and stronger palladium and platinum prices.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:39 PM
  • WDC

    SanDisk's (SNDK +1.4%) gets a boost after its board authorizes a $500M stock buyback. The...

    SanDisk's (SNDK +1.4%) gets a boost after its board authorizes a $500M stock buyback. The announcement seems a bit of an anomaly when you consider the stock is pushing up near its highest level in over four years.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:21 PM | 1 Comment
  • PMCS

    JPMorgan downgrades PMC-Sierra (PMCS -10.2%) to Neutral following a mixed Q3 report, criticizing...

    JPMorgan downgrades PMC-Sierra (PMCS -10.2%) to Neutral following a mixed Q3 report, criticizing PMC’s inability to drive faster growth: New product areas "have yet to generate meaningful revenues. Moreover, Q4 guidance suggests 20% turns business (normal turns rate) in a tough demand environment, which suggests that Q4 guidance may not be conservative enough."

     
     
     
     
    | 12:02 PM
  • COL

    Aviation equipment maker Rockwell Collins (COL -3.3%) trades lower after its FQ4 revenue comes...

    Aviation equipment maker Rockwell Collins (COL -3.3%) trades lower after its FQ4 revenue comes up light, primarily due to reductions in defense spending. Overall Y/Y earnings improved 17% however, driven by stronger sales in the company's commercial systems business and higher operating margins.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM
  • OPLK

    Oplink (OPLK -9.4%) sells off after reporting FQ1 revenue of $43.4M (-12.5% Y/Y) and EPS of...

    Oplink (OPLK -9.4%) sells off after reporting FQ1 revenue of $43.4M (-12.5% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.15; the former beat by $0.4M, but the latter missed by a penny. Moreover, the optical component maker is guiding for FQ2 revenue of $40M-$43M and EPS of $0.07-$0.13, below Street estimates of $44.7M and $0.18.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:53 AM
  • CHOP

    China Gerui Advanced Materials Group (CHOP -32%) dives after an article on SeekingAlpha argues...

    China Gerui Advanced Materials Group (CHOP -32%) dives after an article on SeekingAlpha argues the firm's sales and earnings are overstated. The company's profit margins have been holding steady over the years, even as market prices for their products indicate a squeeze, writes Eiad Asbahi.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:52 AM | 1 Comment
  • SWN

    Southwestern Energy (SWN +3.4%) trades higher after posting a better than expected Q3, as profit...

    Southwestern Energy (SWN +3.4%) trades higher after posting a better than expected Q3, as profit rose 9% Y/Y on increased production in its Fayetteville and Marcellus shale operations. The company raises production guidance for FY11, now expecting gas output in the range of 496 Bcfe - 500 Bcfe.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:43 AM
  • CPSI

    Computer Programs and Systems (CPSI -26.6%) gets hammered after its Q3 results fell short of...

    Computer Programs and Systems (CPSI -26.6%) gets hammered after its Q3 results fell short of Street estimates as system sales dipped 8.5%. The company also guides its Q4 lower, now expecting an EPS of around $0.57 - $0.61 on revenue between $43M - 46M, below analysts' EPS estimates of $0.65 on revenue of $48M.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:18 AM
  • DECK

    Deckers (DECK +9%) makes a new 52-week high after posting a strong Q3 report. The company, which...

    Deckers (DECK +9%) makes a new 52-week high after posting a strong Q3 report. The company, which is seeing booming sales of its UGG boots and aggressively expanding into Europe, expects Q4 revenue to grow 29% Y/Y, above prior guidance of 22%. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:18 AM | 1 Comment
  • NWL

    Newell Rubbermaid (NWL +13.2%) shares soar despite posting a Q3 loss, mostly due to a writedown...

    Newell Rubbermaid (NWL +13.2%) shares soar despite posting a Q3 loss, mostly due to a writedown on the value of its baby and parenting and hardware businesses. Investors like the company's announced restructuring plan aimed at boosting profits and strengthening brands, with anticipated cuts of $90M-$100M in costs by the end of 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:12 AM
  • ALGN

    Align Technology (ALGN +31.4%) pops after knocking out a Q3 earnings and revenue beat led by...

    Align Technology (ALGN +31.4%) pops after knocking out a Q3 earnings and revenue beat led by impressive gains in the sales of the firm's invisible braces. The company expects Q4 revenue in a range of $124M-$128.5M, above the consensus of analysts at $122.6M. Adding to the buying frenzy, a $150M stock repurchasement program was also announced by the firm - repping close to 8% of outstanding shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM | 1 Comment
  • GTATQ

    GT Advanced Technologies (GTAT +4%) is trading higher this morning after announcing it's...

    GT Advanced Technologies (GTAT +4%) is trading higher this morning after announcing it's received a $47.7M order for polysilicon production equipment and technology from Saudi Arabia-based Polysilicon Technology.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:53 AM
  • AVID

    Avid Technology (AVID -13.8%) makes a new multi-year low after its Q3 report demonstrates...

    Avid Technology (AVID -13.8%) makes a new multi-year low after its Q3 report demonstrates cheaper solutions from Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) and Adobe (NASDAQ:ADBE) continue hurting sales of its costly video-editing gear. Revenue of $165M (nearly flat Y/Y) missed consensus by $2M, while EPS of $0.01 missed by $0.07.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:52 AM
  • LVS

    Las Vegas Sands (NYSE:LVS) CEO Sheldon Alderson says on an earnings CC it's all systems go for...

    Las Vegas Sands (NYSE:LVS) CEO Sheldon Alderson says on an earnings CC it's all systems go for forward revenue momentum in U.S., Singapore, and Macau markets. "We see absolutely no reason, again, no catalyst at hand, which would change the upward trend we have been experiencing." Shares are up 8.5% after the company released its Q3 report (I, II) last night.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:41 AM | 2 Comments
  • NUVA

    NuVasive (NUVA -13.8%) sells off after reporting Q3 revenue of $132.9M (+10.5% Y/Y) and EPS of...

    NuVasive (NUVA -13.8%) sells off after reporting Q3 revenue of $132.9M (+10.5% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.26; the latter beat by $0.03, but the former missed by $1.3M. In addition, NuVasive, which is mired in a costly legal battle with MDT, is guiding for 2011 revenue of $538M-$540M and EPS of $1.01-$1.02, below a consensus of $542M and $1.05.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM
  • QTM-OLD

    Quantum (QTM-OLD +9%) pops after its FQ2 revenue easily beat estimates late yesterday on solid...

    Quantum (QTM-OLD +9%) pops after its FQ2 revenue easily beat estimates late yesterday on solid numbers across all units, with sales of its new 6701/2 series with DXi 2.0 coming in particularly strong. Gross margin increased 2% sequentially, primarily due to a shift in product mix toward disk and software. Separately, FBN upgrades the stock to Buy.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:35 AM
  • CY

    Spansion (CODE -25.7%) crashes after reporting Q3 revenue of $258.2M (-16% Y/Y) and EPS of...

    Spansion (CODE -25.7%) crashes after reporting Q3 revenue of $258.2M (-16% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.48, missing consensus by $2.6M and $0.08. Moreover, Spansion, which operates in the slow-growing NOR flash memory market, expects Q4 sales of $205M-$225M and EPS of -$0.17 to -$0.07, far below a consensus of $264.3M and $0.40.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:28 AM
  • NCR

    NCR's (NCR +3%) Q3 profit slipped on a host of one-time pension- and acquisition-related...

    NCR's (NCR +3%) Q3 profit slipped on a host of one-time pension- and acquisition-related charges, but the ATM maker's adjusted results beat Street estimates and shares are rallying. NCR offers upward full-year 2011 guidance, seeing revenue growth of 8%-10% vs. an earlier forecast of 6%-8%, and profits of $1.79-$1.83/share vs. previous $1.73-$1.80/share.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:18 AM
  • LEA

    A significant Q3 earnings miss from Lear (NYSE:LEA) touches off a 6.2% selloff in shares. The...

    A significant Q3 earnings miss from Lear (NYSE:LEA) touches off a 6.2% selloff in shares. The company says customer pricing as well as higher launch and commodity costs bit into earnings. Revenue guidance was increased by the global automotive industry supplier to a range of $13.8B-$14.1B, up from prior guidance of $13.4B-$13.8B.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:12 AM
  • LXK

    Lexmark (LXK +2.5%) catches a bid after initiating a quarterly dividend of $0.25/share....

    Lexmark (LXK +2.5%) catches a bid after initiating a quarterly dividend of $0.25/share. Following today's gain, the dividend gives Lexmark an annual yield of 3.1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:00 AM
  • IPG

    Shares of Interpublic Group (NYSE:IPG) shoot up 17% after the firm's Q3 report beats EPS and...

    Shares of Interpublic Group (NYSE:IPG) shoot up 17% after the firm's Q3 report beats EPS and revenue estimates, as the firm cites "significant contributions in the digital arena." Standing in contrast to peers, the company maintains its prior guidance for full-year organic growth revenue and operating margin.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:55 AM
  • CHTR

    A day after Time Warner Cable (TWC) is hammered by a weak Q3 report (I, II), the same happens to...

    A day after Time Warner Cable (TWC) is hammered by a weak Q3 report (I, II), the same happens to Cablevision (CVC -6.4%). While revenue of $1.67B was in-line, EPS of $0.14 fell well short of a $0.32 consensus. Video subscribers declined by 19K (27K decline in Q2), while broadband subs grew by 17K (5K in Q2), and voice subs by 38K (27K in Q2).

     
     
     
     
    | 9:53 AM
  • MFGLQ

    MF Global (MF -11.9%) bounces sharply off its premarket low of 0.86 instigated by reports that...

    MF Global (MF -11.9%) bounces sharply off its premarket low of 0.86 instigated by reports that the company drew down its credit lines. CNBC reports MF is in "advanced negotiations" with a narrow field of bidders to sell its struggling futures brokerage, hoping to reach a deal by Monday or sooner.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:49 AM | 1 Comment
  • WHR

    JPMorgan weighs in on Whirlpool's (NYSE:WHR) Q3 miss and plan to slash jobs, saying "we believe...

    JPMorgan weighs in on Whirlpool's (NYSE:WHR) Q3 miss and plan to slash jobs, saying "we believe a likely negative stock reaction should be moderated by the company's aggressive restructuring program." Analysts with the firm stay the course, keeping a Neutral rating in place. Shares -11.7% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:11 AM | 1 Comment
  • S

    Premarket gainers: CLWR +10%. AMD +10%. GT +10%. CX +8%. BIDU +7%. BRCD +5%. CLF +4%. TEX +4%....

    Premarket gainers: CLWR +10%. AMD +10%. GT +10%. CX +8%. BIDU +7%. BRCD +5%. CLF +4%. TEX +4%. LVS +4%. TTM +3%. NMR +3%. AEZS +3%. JASO +3%. MRK +3%.
    Losers: MF -27%. WHR -11%. CSTR -8%. ING -7%. RBS -7%. MT -5%. OAS -4%. FRO -4%. ERTS -4%. BCS -4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:05 AM
  • AMD

    AMD is now up 9.8% following its Q3 report (I, II), and an upgrade from Wells Fargo could be...

    AMD is now up 9.8% following its Q3 report (I, II), and an upgrade from Wells Fargo could be helping out. The firm thinks AMD's healthy Q4 guidance suggests the yield issues that contributed to its Q3 warning are being addressed, and notes the improvement in AMD's CPU average selling price stands in contrast to Intel's (NASDAQ:INTC) flat Q/Q pricing. (transcript)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:03 AM | 1 Comment
  • ARCH

    Arch Coal (NYSE:ACI) ties its slip in Q3 profits to flooding in the Midwest as it keeps a...

    Arch Coal (NYSE:ACI) ties its slip in Q3 profits to flooding in the Midwest as it keeps a positive long-term outlook for the global coal market. Though the company concedes "short-term uncertainty," it points to widescale construction of coal-based power plants and large infrastructure needs in Asia and South America as boosting seaborne coal trade over the long haul. Updated EPS guidance falls in at $1.00-$1.40, compared to analysts' consensus of $1.28. Shares -4.6% premarket.

  • GT
